ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Form used/assessment name
Notes: e.g., Self-Report, Parent Form, Short Form, Revised Version

ElementDescription: Time Point
Notes: 888 = not applicable; 999 = missing

ElementDescription: S: 1 I know what transition meetings are/ P: 1 My child knows what transition meetings are
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = disagree; 3 = agree; 4 = strongly agree; 888 = not applicable; 999 = missing

ElementDescription: S: 2 I am always invited to my transition meetings/ P: 2 My child is always invited to his or her transition meetings
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = disagree; 3 = agree; 4 = strongly agree; 888 = not applicable; 999 = missing

ElementDescription: S: 3 I lead my transition meetings/ P: 3 My child leads his or her transition meetings
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = disagree; 3 = agree; 4 = strongly agree; 888 = not applicable; 999 = missing

ElementDescription: S: 4 I express my concerns and thoughts in my transition meetings/ P: 4 My child expresses his or her concerns and thoughts in his or her transition meetings
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = disagree; 3 = agree; 4 = strongly agree; 888 = not applicable; 999 = missing

ElementDescription: S: 5 I know my goals after high school/ P: 5 My child knows his or her goals after high school
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = disagree; 3 = agree; 4 = strongly agree; 888 = not applicable; 999 = missing

ElementDescription: S: 6 I set my transition goals with my teachers and parents/ P: 6 My child sets his or her transition goals with my teachers and parents
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = disagree; 3 = agree; 4 = strongly agree; 888 = not applicable; 999 = missing

ElementDescription: S: 7 My goals after high school are related to my interests and dreams/ P: 7 My child's goals after high school are related to his or her interests and dreams
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = disagree; 3 = agree; 4 = strongly agree; 888 = not applicable; 999 = missing

ElementDescription: S: 8 I know what I need to do to achieve my transition goals/ P: 8 My child knows what she or he needs to do to achieve his or her transition goals
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = disagree; 3 = agree; 4 = strongly agree; 888 = not applicable; 999 = missing

ElementDescription: S: 9 I am aFEe to tell others what I like and do not like clearly/ P: 9 My child is aFEe to clearly tell others what he or she likes and does not like
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = disagree; 3 = agree; 4 = strongly agree; 888 = not applicable; 999 = missing

ElementDescription: S: 10 I know what I want to do after high school/ P: 10 My child knows what he or she wants to do after high school
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = disagree; 3 = agree; 4 = strongly agree; 888 = not applicable; 999 = missing

ElementDescription: S: 11 What I want to do after high school is realistic/ P: 11 What my child wants to do after high school is realistic
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = disagree; 3 = agree; 4 = strongly agree; 888 = not applicable; 999 = missing

ElementDescription: S: 12 . I have a say about what I am going to do after high school/ P: 12 My child has a say about what he or she is going to do after high school
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = disagree; 3 = agree; 4 = strongly agree; 888 = not applicable; 999 = missing

ElementDescription: Student Self Determination total
Notes: 888 = not applicable; 999 = missing

ElementDescription: Who completed the form?
Notes: RA; Self-Report; Informant

ElementDescription: How frequently do you think your child sets short-term goals during school work (i.e., to get 10 problems done before dinner)?
Notes: 0=Never; 1=Sometimes; 2=Frequently; 3=Always

ElementDescription: How frequently do you think your child sets long-term goals during school work (i.e., to get an A on an upcoming test)?
Notes: 0=Never; 1=Sometimes; 2=Frequently; 3=Always

ElementDescription: How frequently do you think your child sets short-term goals during household tasks (i.e., makes a list of chores he or she would like to complete over the weekend)?
Notes: 0=Never; 1=Sometimes; 2=Frequently; 3=Always

ElementDescription: How frequently do you think your child sets long-term goals during household tasks (i.e. to redecorate his or her room)?
Notes: 0=Never; 1=Sometimes; 2=Frequently; 3=Always

ElementDescription: How frequently do you think your child uses short-term goal setting as a strategy when he or she is having trouble finding motivation to do school work?
Notes: 0=Never; 1=Sometimes; 2=Frequently; 3=Always

ElementDescription: How frequently do you think your child uses long-term goal setting as a strategy when he or she is having trouble finding motivation to do school work?
Notes: 0=Never; 1=Sometimes; 2=Frequently; 3=Always
